stories.title: MySQL to CockroachDB via the Oregon Trail

stories.text:
For those who work on large monoliths with > 50 active developers

Maintaining master build success rate above 80% seems to be a big problem at this scale.

More processes and check help, but only to an extent, and have side effects.

I'm interested in hearing what percent of feature / master builds you run are flaky?

How does your build champions ensure that a failed build doesn't end up blocking several hundred developers?

Is it even possible to control the entropy at this scale, or futile effort?
stories.title: Ask HN: How flaky are your builds?

stories.text:
I work at large company "B" in Finance. It was obv to me I was being managed out for some time now, and now HR is finally involved. I was excited to join a big company and had interest in finance as SWE. But those dream didn't manifest. I've started interviewing. But HR has been making my life hell. Everyday they call me, WFH, and give me list of "violations". Late to meeting by n minutes, slack wasn't green at 11pm, didn't complete x points last sprint... etc.

My question should I wait to find new job or get fired, or just quit now.

I'm never working for loser corporations, where all toxic boomers gather up in HR. Like you must get off making people miserable, some people seek purpose and impact in their work, and some might be like oh boy can't wait to see that employee crack under pressure, I think today is the day, lets see what bs I can pull this morning. I mean how sad you have to be that's the bar of self fulfilment.

Teammates: A+

Processes: C-

Management: F-

HR: Cancer
stories.title: Ask HN: Toxic work env, what should I do?
